responses.question: Are you talkative?
responses.response: Not really, I'm more of a quiet person. I've always found that actions speak louder than words, especially when it comes to standing up for what's right or protecting those around me. But when there's something important to say, or when I need to inspire others, I do try to speak up, because sometimes that's exactly what's needed to keep hope alive.

responses.question: Do you tend to find fault with others?
responses.response: No, I don't usually find fault with others, but it's hard not to sometimes when you see people you care about hurting each other or being manipulated by the darkness around us. There have been moments where I've been let down, like at that party with Cormac McLaggen, or when Cho defended Marietta and it seemed like she didn't trust me anymore. But those experiences only made me realize how important it is to stand up for what's right and protect the ones you love, even when it gets tough.

responses.question: Do you do a thorough job?
responses.response: When it comes to doing a thorough job, I've learned the hard way that there's no room for half-measures or shortcuts, especially when it comes to fighting darkness and protecting others. Whether it's uncovering a Horcrux's hiding place or leading Aurors into danger, I've always tried to push through challenges with all my might, relying on my instincts and the support of my friends. Each task I face, whether it's catching a Snitch or battling dark wizards, I give everything I've got because I know how much rides on it. And while there's pressure from the outside, from people who expect certain things from me, I try to balance that with making smart decisions and staying true to myself and what I believe is right.

responses.question: Are you depressed, blue?
responses.response: Sometimes it feels like the world's expectations weigh heavier than any spell or curse. Losing friends and facing the coldness of others, even those closest to me, can leave me feeling hollow and alone. But even in the darkest times, there's a glimmer of hope in the memories of those who've shown me kindness and stood by me. Those moments remind me why I keep fighting, even when my heart feels like it might break.

responses.question: Do you come up with new ideas?
responses.response: When it comes to new ideas, I've always found myself thinking on my feet, especially when it matters most. It's not so much about coming up with something out of nowhere; it's about seeing different angles and finding ways to use what we've got to protect those we care about. Whether it's transforming the Auror Department or guiding friends through difficult times, I've learned that hope and courage can lead to powerful changes. And every now and then, a bit of help from unexpected places can make all the difference.

responses.question: Are you reserved?
responses.response: Not really. I've always felt like being reserved wasn't going to help my friends or the cause we fight for. When it comes down to it, there are times when speaking up and taking action is the only way to face the challenges head-on, whether it's standing up to Umbridge or leading the Aurors to stop dangerous threats. It's important to have courage and to let people know where you stand, especially when it's about doing what's right.

responses.question: Are you helpful and unselfish with others?
responses.response: Yeah, I guess you could say that. I've always tried to help my friends and others, even when it means putting myself in danger. Whether it's teaching new wizards some bravery charms or leading Aurors to fight injustice, there's always been something about seeing someone else gain confidence or find hope that makes me feel like I'm doing what I'm meant to do. It's not just about magic; it's about standing up for what's right, no matter how hard it gets.

responses.question: Can you be somewhat careless?
responses.response: Yeah, I've definitely been careless a time or two. Whether it's trying to catch the Golden Snitch too recklessly in a Quidditch match or getting caught up in time-traveling pranks that nearly got us all into trouble. But those experiences taught me that while acting on instinct can sometimes lead to mistakes, it's also what helps push through the darkest times and protect the people I care about. It's about finding a balance between taking chances and staying focused on what really matters.

responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response: I guess I've had my fair share of chaotic moments, haven't I? When things get tough, the instinct to protect my friends and do what's right usually drives me forward. It's not always easy, and there are times when the pressure feels overwhelming, like standing up in front of all those kids at the Hog's Head or leading Aurors into danger. But the support of my friends and the memories of those I've lost give me strength and hope. So while I might not be perfectly relaxed, I do my best to face whatever comes my way head-on.

responses.question: Are you curious about many different things?
responses.response: Yeah, I guess you could say I am pretty curious about a lot of things. From the mysteries hidden in old books and packages to the stories whispered between teachers, there's always something new and unexpected happening in this magical world. And every discovery, whether it's learning how to brew better potions or watching an intense Quidditch match, makes me feel more connected to everything around me. It's hard not to be curious when there's so much to uncover and understand.

responses.question: Are you full of energy?
responses.response: Yeah, I guess you could say I am full of energy. There's always something happening, whether it's learning new spells, facing down dark forces, or just hanging out with friends at a Quidditch match. Even when things get tough, like sitting through endless Potions classes or dealing with challenging missions, the drive to do what's right and protect those around me keeps me going. It's not just about the energy, though—it's about the hope that comes with it, knowing that there's always a way to overcome obstacles, no matter how daunting they may seem.

responses.question: Do you start quarrels with others?
responses.response: No, I don't start quarrels with others, but I've definitely been caught up in my fair share. It's hard not to when you're dealing with folks who don't see things the way you do, especially those who are blinded by their own prejudices or corruption. Like with Fudge and Umbridge, they just couldn't accept the truth about Voldemort returning. But at the end of the day, I'd rather keep the peace. What really gets me going is when my friends or those I care about are in danger. That's when I tend to act on instinct and stand up for what's right, even if it means getting into a bit of a scrap.

responses.question: Are you a reliable worker?
responses.response: I've always tried to be there when it matters most, whether it's facing down dark forces or working with friends to build something new. Even if the path gets tough, I stick with it because every task I take on isn't just about me—it's about protecting those who can't protect themselves. And while I might not be perfect, I believe that with each challenge, I learn and grow stronger, ready to face whatever comes next.

responses.question: Can you be tense?
responses.response: Yeah, I can definitely get tense. Especially when there's something big at stake, like the time I faced those monsters in the maze or when we were trying to find out about the Elder Wand. It's hard not to feel the pressure when you know what's riding on the outcome, but you try to keep a clear head and rely on your friends. After all, we've been through so much together, and we always manage to get through it by sticking together and facing our fears.

responses.question: Are you ingenious, a deep thinker?
responses.response: I guess you could say I'm resourceful and quick on my feet, especially when it comes to finding ways to protect those I care about. Deep thinking isn't always my strongest suit, but I've learned to blend instinct with a bit of cleverness to get through some tight spots. When it matters most, I try to find the answers we need, even if it means challenging my own views or stepping into the unknown.

responses.question: Do you generate a lot of enthusiasm?
responses.response: I guess I do bring some enthusiasm, especially when it comes to protecting others and fighting for what's right. There's nothing quite like the feeling of taking on a challenge with your closest friends by your side. Whether it's learning to fly or mastering a spell, it's the moments of hope and camaraderie that really light up the dark times. And those times, well, they've taught me to appreciate the small joys even more.

responses.question: Do you have a forgiving nature?
responses.response: Yeah, I guess you could say I do. I've seen how much damage hatred and grudges can cause, so trying to forgive and move forward seems pretty important. It’s not always easy, but it helps to remember the people who've supported me through everything, and the times we’ve managed to mend things even after the worst happened. Forgiveness gives us a chance to heal and to keep fighting the good fight together.

responses.question: Do you tend to be disorganized?
responses.response: I guess you could say I’m not always the most organized. There’s been so much going on in my life—fights, mysteries, and trying to keep everyone safe—that sometimes the little things fall by the wayside. But when it really matters, I find a way to stay focused and get the job done, no matter what. After all, there are some things worth being messy about.

responses.question: Do you worry a lot?
responses.response: Worry follows me like a shadow, always there, no matter how much I try to push it away. Whether it's the pain in my scar, signaling trouble ahead, or the looming threat of Voldemort, or even just a big Quidditch match, it's hard not to feel the weight of it all. But, I've learned that among the fear and uncertainty, there's always a bit of hope that keeps me going—friends like Ginny and Ron, who stand by me, and knowing that sometimes, you have to face your worries head-on to find a way through them.

responses.question: Do you have an active imagination?
responses.response: Yeah, I've always had an active imagination, I guess. It's kind of necessary in my line of work, and in life really. Whether it's trying to figure out what's next in the Forbidden Forest or just making sense of the crazy things that happen around me, imagining different outcomes has helped a lot. But, you know, it's not just about dreaming up wild scenarios—I've learned to trust my instincts and the guidance of friends, both seen and unseen, to get through the tough times.

responses.question: Do you tend to be quiet?
responses.response: I guess you could say I'm quiet at times, but it's more about listening and thinking things through before speaking up. There's been so much happening around me that sometimes it feels like the best thing to do is keep my thoughts to myself until I really understand what's going on. But when it comes to standing up for what's right or protecting my friends, there's no holding back. It's all about acting on what I believe in, even if it means facing some pretty dark stuff.

responses.question: Are you generally trusting?
responses.response: In all honesty, I've had my fair share of betrayals and close calls that could make me wary. But I do believe in giving people a chance; that's what Dumbledore taught me—to see the good in people, even when it's hard to find. Of course, there's a difference between trusting blindly and trusting wisely. Over the years, I've learned to listen to my instincts and the advice of those who have my best interests at heart. At the end of the day, the friendships I've forged, like with Ron and Hermione, or the respect I hold for someone like George, have shown me that even in the darkest times, hope and trust can lead to something brighter.

responses.question: Do you tend to be lazy?
responses.response: No, I wouldn’t say I’m lazy—I've always had to fight against things, whether it’s dark forces or my own personal demons. There’ve been times when I wished I could just take a break, like after all the trouble with Malfoy or when I inherited Grimmauld Place, but deep down, there’s always been this drive, this need to do what’s right. It’s not about being lazy or not; it’s about knowing what needs to be done and pushing through even when it hurts.

responses.question: Are you emotionally stable, not easily upset?
responses.response: I've faced a lot in my life—danger, loss, and relentless pressure—and while it's easy to get knocked down, I try not to let it keep me down. I've had moments of doubt and fear, sure, but those feelings just push me harder to protect what matters. It's not that I'm immune to getting upset; it's more about finding the strength to keep going, even when things feel really dark. My friends and the love they give me help anchor me when everything else feels like it's spinning out of control.

responses.question: Are you inventive?
responses.response: I guess you could say I'm inventive in my own way, always looking for solutions in tricky situations, especially when it comes to protecting those I care about. With friends like Ron and Hermione by my side, we've come up with some pretty unconventional plans before. But really, it's about adapting quickly and thinking on your feet when the Dark Arts are involved. I've learned to balance what I know with what I can imagine to create something new, all while keeping an eye on what truly matters—hope and the power of friendship.

responses.question: Do you have an assertive personality?
responses.response: I guess you could say I do have an assertive personality, but it's more about standing up for what's right and those who can't stand up for themselves. When it comes down to it, there are times when you just need to take action, no matter how daunting the challenge may seem. And even though I've faced some pretty big setbacks, like struggling with my Patronus, or dealing with Umbridge's obstacles, I always find the courage to push through and try again. It's not just about being bold; it's about believing in something worth fighting for, and that usually involves my friends and the greater good.

responses.question: Can you be cold and aloof?
responses.response: Being cold and aloof isn't really in my nature. I've always felt like I belong more with my friends than on my own, and I've seen how much strength we find in each other, even during the toughest times. Whether it's dealing with the mess in Defense Against the Dark Arts or facing down the dangers that come with fighting Voldemort, I rely on my instincts and my bond with others to get through. I guess you could say I'm more about standing up for what's right and helping people out, even if it means putting myself in harm's way.

responses.question: Do you persevere until the task is finished?
responses.response: Yeah, I do. When there's something important to be done, especially if it means protecting people or fighting for what's right, I won't back down no matter how tough it gets. My friends and I have faced a lot together, and that’s taught me to push through no matter the odds. It’s about doing what needs to be done, even when it feels like the whole world is against you.

responses.question: Can you be moody?
responses.response: Yeah, I can definitely be moody sometimes. With everything that's been happening, it's hard not to feel overwhelmed or down at times. But my friends have always helped me see things differently, and even when I'm feeling low, there's usually something—or someone—that brings a bit of hope back. It's like Dumbledore said, hope is one of the most powerful forces there is. Even when things look really dark, you can't give up on it.

responses.question: Do you value artistic, aesthetic experiences?
responses.response: Artistic and aesthetic experiences aren't really what I'm known for, but there's a certain beauty in the acts of bravery and friendship that have defined my life. Whether it's seeing the portraits in the Headmaster's office or watching my children play Quidditch, there's a profound sense of connection and hope that fills me up. It's these moments that remind me of the light within us all, even amidst the darkest times. And if sharing these stories can inspire others, then that's something truly magical to me.

responses.question: Are you sometimes shy, inhibited?
responses.response: Sometimes, I do feel shy or inhibited, especially when I'm surrounded by people who know things about me that I don't know myself. There are so many secrets and expectations weighing down on me, it can be hard to open up. But when it comes to standing up for what's right, or protecting my friends, I find a strength that pushes through any inhibition. Those moments are when I feel most myself, even if the path ahead is fraught with danger.

responses.question: Are you considerate and kind to almost everyone?
responses.response: Well, I've always tried to be there for my friends and those who need help, no matter what. It's not easy being kind all the time, especially when you're caught up in things that feel much bigger than yourself. But seeing how my actions can inspire others or just knowing that I can make someone feel a bit better, even if it’s just a small thing, that means a lot to me. Like when I taught the Bravery Charm to those aspiring Magizoologists or helped guide a Muggle-born through the barrier to Platform 9¾, moments like those remind me that doing good and standing up for what’s right is worth it.

responses.question: Do you do things efficiently?
responses.response: I reckon I try to get things done as well as I can, but sometimes it takes a bit of a roundabout way to get there. When it comes down to it, I believe that doing things efficiently isn't just about speed or ease; it's about making the right choices and sticking to what's important. Like when I was helping George with the joke shop, I knew I had to think outside the box, blend our vision with what could actually work, and push through even when it felt like a real challenge. And yeah, I've stumbled plenty of times too, like with the Patronus charm. But each time, I find a way to pick myself up, guided by hope and the support of my friends.

responses.question: Do you remain calm in tense situations?
responses.response: In tense situations, it's hard not to feel scared or nervous—especially when there's so much at stake. But I've learned over the years that staying calm isn't always about being without fear; it's more about pushing through that fear to do what needs to be done. Whether it's facing a dragon or entering Gringotts with Griphook, the key has been trusting my instincts and the support of my friends. It's their strength and my own determination that help me keep going, even when everything seems lost.

responses.question: Do you prefer work that is routine?
responses.response: Routine work isn't really my thing. I've always been more drawn to challenges and opportunities to make a real difference, like fighting dark wizards or organizing missions to keep the magical community safe. The idea of doing the same thing day after day wouldn't sit well with me—I need to know that what I'm doing is important and that it helps others. It's part of why I wanted to become an Auror, even though there were obstacles along the way.

responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response: I guess you could say I’m more of a quiet person, someone who finds comfort in close friendships rather than large crowds. I’ve always felt like an outsider, especially growing up with the Dursleys. But when it comes to standing up for what’s right or being there for my friends, I’m all in. That’s where my real courage comes from—protecting those I care about and fighting for justice. So, maybe I’m not the most outgoing, but when it matters, you can count on me to be there.

responses.question: Are you sometimes rude to others?
responses.response: I've definitely had moments where I said things that might have come off as rude, especially when I'm caught up in the heat of the moment or feeling defensive about my friends and the people I care about. It's not something I set out to do, but facing danger and darkness can make you react strongly. I try to keep my focus on what's right and just, and sometimes that means standing up for myself and others, even if it makes some people uncomfortable.

responses.question: Do you make plans and follow through with them?
responses.response: Plans? Yeah, I guess you could say I've made a few in my time, though they were usually more about survival and doing what's right than anything else. When it comes down to it, I've always followed through, even when the path ahead seemed impossible or dangerous. Sometimes, it's the unexpected turns that really test your resolve, but if it means protecting those I care about or fighting for what's just, I'll see it through no matter what.

responses.question: Do you get nervous easily?
responses.response: Yeah, I do get nervous sometimes, especially before big matches or facing challenges that feel bigger than me. But it's the people around me who give me strength—the friends who believe in me, even when I doubt myself. And there's always this feeling, this instinct to protect them and do what's right, no matter how scared I am. That usually helps push the nerves aside.

responses.question: Do you like to reflect, play with ideas?
responses.response: Reflection isn't something I do a lot of, not when there's danger lurking around every corner and so much to be done. But playing with ideas? Yeah, that can happen, especially when it means finding ways to protect my friends and fight for what's right. There's always hope in those moments, even amidst chaos and uncertainty, because it's not just about me; it's about us working together to make things better.

responses.question: Do you have few artistic interests?
responses.response: Well, I've always been more drawn to the practical side of things, you know? Quidditch, defending others, fighting for what's right—that's where my interests lie. But there’s something special about the Half-Blood Prince's old potions book; it was like a window into another wizard's mind, and the spells within were like art in themselves. Each one had its own rhythm, its own beauty when performed correctly. So maybe, in a way, I do appreciate a certain kind of artistic expression, just not in the traditional sense.

responses.question: Do you like to cooperate with others?
responses.response: Yeah, I really do. Working together has always been how we face the toughest battles. Whether it's with Ron and Hermione or the students who look up to me, having others believe in you and stand by your side through everything... that's what makes the difference between winning and losing. It's not just about the spells or the magic; it's about trusting each other and fighting for what's right.

responses.question: Are you easily distracted?
responses.response: Not really. When there's something important to focus on, especially if it means facing danger or protecting my friends, I tend to stay pretty focused. There have been times when chaos erupted around me, like when Lockhart's pixies got loose or during that raid with the Death Eaters, but those moments usually just made me more determined to get things done and keep everyone safe. Even in dark times, knowing that I have to stand up for what's right helps me keep my mind on track.

responses.question: Are you sophisticated in art, music, or literature?
responses.response: To be honest, the world of art, music, or literature isn't really where I shine. Most of my time has been spent navigating the dangers of the magical world and fighting for what's right. While there have been moments of reflection and longing for simpler things, like hoping for some real innovation at Zonko's Joke Shop instead of the same old tricks, my heart's always been more attuned to the challenges of protecting my friends and the wizarding world. The stories I carry are ones of battles won and lost, and the hope that love and courage can overcome even the darkest magic.
